org.magelan.core.db
Class EntityDataSource

java.lang.Object
  org.magelan.core.db.AbstractDataSource
      org.magelan.core.db.EntityDataSource
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, DataSource
public class EntityDataSource
extends AbstractDataSource

Represents the properties of the entities from a drawing model as data source.

Version:
1.0, 02/2006
Author:
Assen Antov

getFields

public java.lang.String[] getFields()
Description copied from interface: DataSource
Returns the names of the available fields. The names are transformed to upper case. References to them are case insensitive. The exact format of field names depends on the underlying database.

Returns:
an array of the available field names

getTypes

public java.lang.Class[] getTypes()
Description copied from interface: DataSource
Returns the types of the available fields. The types are implementation specific. A type may be not only one of the primitive data types or their wrapper classes, but any class.

Returns:
an array of fields' types

get

public java.util.Iterator get(java.lang.String field,
                              java.lang.Object value,
                              java.lang.String[] flds)
Description copied from interface: DataSource
Returns an iterator of Row instances, representing the rows for which the parameter field is equal to the parameter value. The returned Row instances contain only the values of the fields referred to by the fields parameter.

Parameters:
field - field to query
value - value to query
flds - list of fields to get
Returns:
an iterator of rows

Returns:

flush

public void flush()
Description copied from interface: DataSource
Calling this method on the DataSource will result in permanently saving any changes made using the Row.set(int, Object), Row#set(String, Object) and Row.delete() methods. It should be expected that until such time that the method is invoked any changes to the DataSource exist only in memory. It is possible, however, that an implementation permanently saves changes immediately and does not need this method to be called. Although an implementation may occasionally perform flushes, they are generally not automatically invoked.

Returns:
the Row at position idx
